title: Renters are staying put. What does it mean for housing affordability?
summary: Renters are staying put longer than they were a decade ago amid the ongoing housing affordability crisis. In fact, 1 in 6 people, or 16.6%, are staying in their home for at least a decade. That's up from the 13.9% of people reported a decade ago, according to data from real estate brokerage Redfin.
